pr_title: Support response content-type with versioned media type

timeline.message: guess  what was the  response type
take media type from  provided xconttenttype
format response content type basing on params
tests relying on xcontent being in cannonical form - not chaning

timeline.bodyText: this is to assert that during bulk api all requests have the same contentype. Used by rest HLRC
timeline.author: pgomulka

timeline.bodyText:
mapParser keeps the original provided contentType - for instance VND_JSON
parser.contentType in this test is created from createParser(xContentType.xContent() which looses the information about the original VND_JSON
timeline.author: pgomulka

timeline.bodyText: do we care about versioned media types in watcher's HttpRequest?
timeline.author: pgomulka
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -499,17 +498,17 @@ public Builder fromUrl(String supposedUrl) {
      * Write a request via toXContent, but filter certain parts of it - this is needed to not expose secrets
      *
      * @param request        The HttpRequest object to serialize
-     * @param xContent       The xContent from the parent outputstream builder
+     * @param xContentType   The XContentType from the parent outputstream builder
      * @param params         The ToXContentParams from the parent write
      * @param excludeField   The field to exclude
      * @return               A bytearrayinputstream that contains the serialized request
      * @throws IOException   if an IOException is triggered in the underlying toXContent method
      */
-    public static InputStream filterToXContent(HttpRequest request, XContent xContent, ToXContent.Params params,
+    public static InputStream filterToXContent(HttpRequest request, XContentType xContentType, Params params,
                                                String excludeField) throws IOException {
         try (ByteArrayOutputStream bos = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
-             XContentBuilder filteredBuilder = new XContentBuilder(xContent, bos,
-                     Collections.emptySet(), Collections.singleton(excludeField))) {
+             XContentBuilder filteredBuilder = new XContentBuilder(xContentType.xContent(), bos,

replies.bodyText: no, at least not for now.
replies.author: jakelandis

timeline.bodyText: Can this be more explicit ? if (vnd_json) then return json.ordinal ? (just for readability)
timeline.author: jakelandis

replies.bodyText: I am not sure I understand this. Where should the if vnd_json be used?
replies.author: pgomulka

replies.bodyText: as discussed offline, we can implement this with xContentType.canonical().ordinal()
replies.author: pgomulka

timeline.author: jakelandis

replies.bodyText: Aded some javadoc. this one is harder to explain, I tried to use 'inheritance' analogy. Can you give it a second look?
replies.author: pgomulka

replies.bodyText:
I would suggest to mention that the canonical type represents the general data structure that is used to serialize or deserialize the data from/to for HTTP. More specialized XContent types such as vnd* variants still use the general data structure but may have semantic differences.
I would avoid the word derive or inheritance to avoid conflating with the OO definitions of those. Flavor, specializations, custom, standard, etc. I think are all good descriptors.
replies.author: jakelandis

timeline.bodyText: Can you add an java assert to StreamOutput#.writeEnum to ensure that XContentType is not being serialized there ?
timeline.author: jakelandis
jakelandis

timeline.bodyText: something to consider for later ... but I wonder if there is any overlap between the responseContentTypeString set here and ParsedMediaType. Meaning that ParsedMediaType is essentially  String -> Parts... I wonder if there is the opposite where we could pass a ResponseMediaType that would be Parts -> String. It would clean up the contract abit since String as parameters is a fairly loose contract.
timeline.author: jakelandis
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -191,16 +193,22 @@ public XContentBuilder(XContent xContent, OutputStream bos, Set includes * remaining fields against the inclusive filters. *

* Make sure to call {@link #close()} when the builder is done with. - * - * @param os the output stream + * @param os the output stream * @param includes the inclusive filters: only fields and objects that match the inclusive filters will be written to the output. * @param excludes the exclusive filters: only fields and objects that don't match the exclusive filters will be written to the output. + * @param responseContentTypeString a content-type header value to be send back on a response */ - public XContentBuilder(XContent xContent, OutputStream os, Set includes, Set excludes) throws IOException { + public XContentBuilder(XContent xContent, OutputStream os, Set includes, Set excludes,

replies.bodyText:
I think this is a good idea. The problem is thought that in AbstractRestChannel where we create XContentBuilder https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch/pull/65500/files#diff-05da46b91fb0631c2c11e6aba2b58fa150162cf6c55bcd9bd5751b704090e8d8R137 ResponseContentType can be created in different ways.
We would have to create an XContentType first (in one case it is created from ParsedMediaType), then create ParsedMediaType out of it.
I think overall it is still better then just a string.
updated the PR. let me know what you think
replies.author: pgomulka

replies.bodyText: Looks good, thanks for the change. Much better contract than String.
replies.author: jakelandis

timeline.bodyText: I think the MediaTypeRegistry class level java doc could use a minor update with this change.
timeline.author: jakelandis

timeline.bodyText: nit: if want to leave this todo, can you make it TODO:  and add a possible reason ... i guess i don't see how would belong in XContentType ?
timeline.author: jakelandis

replies.bodyText:
hm when thinking about this now, it would probably more fit into handler.supportsContentStream(xContentType).
Will fix the todo
replies.author: pgomulka

timeline.message: response media type to be a ParsedMediaType instead of just a string
fix tests and new test for request/response headers

timeline.bodyText:
I replaced this one to be consistent with what ES will now return.
no space after media type
and lowercased parameters
timeline.author: pgomulka

replies.bodyText: +1 on consistency ... just want to make sure it is not required since these should be case insensitive right ?
replies.author: jakelandis

replies.bodyText:
in fact.. this is a great question because it might not be..
https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch/blob/master/server/src/main/java/org/elasticsearch/script/Script.java#L636
here a simple equals is used on the option provided vs xcontentType.mediaType (I assume it can be provided by a user, need to confirm).
I will  discuss this with scripting team
replies.author: pgomulka

timeline.bodyText: only if charset was on a request it will be returned back
timeline.author: pgomulka

timeline.bodyText: just to make it consistent with other usages of charset in our codebase, but it actually is not relevant to the PR
timeline.author: pgomulka
